newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina's Banco Rio renews U.S. commercial paper.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Banco Rio renews U.S. commercial paper.

text.p: Argentina's Banco Rio de la Plata SA said Wednesday it is renewing its U.S. commercial paper program with BankAmerica.

The program, which will last for one year, is worth $270 million. BankAmerica structured and syndicated the operation among 26 international banks. This renews a similar program last year worth $100 million, which was also organized by BankAmerica.

"The large number of banks that participated in this transaction shows our solid relations with leading international banks. This was a key factor in the success of the program," said Marcelo Pestarino, manager of the international division of Banco Rio, in a press release.

BankAmerica Securities Inc., Chase Securities Inc., Lehman Commercial Paper Inc. and Merrill Lynch Money Markets Inc. acted as co-dealers for the program. It is guaranteed by a letter of credit from Bayerische Vereinsbank AG
